content: A construction helper is a general utility employee who assists skilled workers, often unskilled but may have various skills. They could be craftsmen or journeymen forced by economic reasons to take lower-level work. Helpers are usually not union members and are paid less than skilled workers, but can perform equally well in certain tasks. They are valued for their lower cost and flexibility in accepting different types of work. A construction helper can be a valuable addition to a work crew, performing narrow aspects of complex tasks under supervision. The debate continues on the economic efficiency and quality of workmanship of having helpers work alongside skilled workers.
